title: IT Technical Writer - Software
body:
OneSpan looking for an energetic TECHNICAL WRITER to join our international and diverse team in Vienna!

At OneSpan you will be part of a team that is trusted by more than 10.000 organizations around the world to safeguard their customers against cyber-crime and fraud, and deliver exceptional digital experiences that build lasting customer loyalty. Your contribution will help us to push the boundaries of what is possible to improve the security and lives of millions of people around the world - in short: what YOU do here MATTERS!

You will produce quality documentation that will make our products easier to use. You will bring existing documentation onto next level and being future-fit. As part of a global team of technical writers, you will work collaboratively with product owners, developers and subject matter experts to produce high quality modern documentation on all according platforms.

We believe in team spirit and collegiality as it is crucial in achieving our common goals! We are convinced: A pleasant working environment brings out the best in people!

WHAT WE OFFER

Varying, challenging work

international team within international company

pleasant working environment, team-spirit and collegiality

interesting, diverse products

agile environment, SCRUM

flexible working hours

Onboarding, mentoring program: get up to speed quickly

modern technologies

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Constantly communicating and working with product owners, engineering/development team members and various subject matter experts to retrieve technical details needed for documentation.

Produce clear, concise and high quality documentation for a diverse internal and customer-facing audiences.

Reviewing/revising content provided by non-technical writers to apply with styles and guidelines.

Planning and editing of illustrations, diagrams and graphics

Participate in planning, developing, writing, editing, publishing and maintain documentation.

Help design, create, and maintain an effective information architecture.

Publish to multiple target media (HTML, PDF, etc.)

Continually improve current documentation in light on customer and internal feedback.

Ensure that our documentation consistently satisfy best practices.

Provide effort estimates on documentation tasks and projects.

Report progress on documentation initiatives, tasks and products.

Participate in team meetings, ad-hoc projects and other doc related initiatives.

Requirements:
A minimum of 5 years of professional work experience as a technical writer, preferably documenting enterprise software.

A university degree in a relevant field (e.g., technical writing, computer science, English, journalism, science, engineering).

Experience and a very strong working knowledge with MadCap Flare

Experience with distributed version-control tools (e.g., Subversion and GitLab )

Experience with distributed bug-tracking and issue-sharing tools ( Jira and Confluence )

Experience with imaging software for screen capturing and illustrating ( Fireworks , Illustrator , Visio )

Experience with Localization (delivering technical documentation in multiple language).

Experienced with Microsoft 365, Acrobat, Snag-it would be preferable

Impeccable knowledge and command of English (written and spoken)

Mastery of the fundamental principles of technical writing

Good understanding of the agile software development environment.

Good understanding of information security and privacy concepts would be preferable.

Demonstrated ability to write clearly with a quick turnaround time.

Ability to grasp complex concepts quickly, and to make them easily understood by others

A passion and ability for making complex technologies comprehensible to others.

Strong problem-solving skills

Attention to detail and rigor in your work

Ability to manage deadlines, priorities, and multiple concurrent tasks

Ability to deliver high-quality technical documentation on time, even under tight deadlines

Ability to create documentation independently, and yet work as part of a team

A nice to have: knowledge in French

You feel addressed? Join our team! We are looking forward to getting to know YOU!
